Summary: The 3 West Club is in a central location near Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, and many restaurants, with the theater district a short walk away. Some rooms overlook W 51st Street, and street noise may be a problem for light sleepers.

Located in the Theater District and on Restaurant Row, the 414 Hotel is near many bars and restaurants and within walking distance of Times Square. Some guests noted that there could be street noise at night.

60 Thompson has a rooftop bar, Thom Bar, and restaurant; some report noise from the lobby bar, which remains open until late. The bars can be closed for private events, restricting access for hotel guests.

The hotel houses a popular New York sushi restaurant and bar that is open late, and it is near a few nice bars and restaurants. The hotel lobby is used to create a hip and happening scene with music, especially on weekends, but the noise does not reach the rooms.

70 Park Avenue is within walking distance of Grand Central station with the Silverleaf Tavern on-site; some reviewers noted noise from neighboring rooms or street traffic. A few reviewers mentioned nearby nightlife options.

The Ace Hotel has a lively lobby scene on weekend nights, with the guest floors being well sound-proofed against the lobby noise. The hotel bar is a great place for a first or end-of-night drink and the lobby is a fun place to hang out.

The Affinia 50 is centrally located with a nightclub next door and within walking distance of many restaurants and bars in the surrounding streets. The buzz of NYC is part of the experience, although higher floors may reduce street noise.

The Affinia Dumont is in the Murray Hill area which is described as near the subway and has "some good bars". Some reviews mention it is within walking distance to attractions including Times Square and Grand Central.

The Affinia Gardens is located on the Upper East Side, a quieter part of the city, with grocery stores and restaurants nearby, and is within walking distance of Central Park and Bloomingdales. Some reviewers mentioned that the location was not ideal for experiencing NYC nightlife.

The hotel is centrally located near Penn Station and Times Square, with a busy bar and restaurant. Some reviewers mention noise from the street and nearby fire station, which could contribute to the city nightlife experience.

The hotel features a rooftop bar with views of the Empire State and Chrysler buildings that is open to the public and is often busy, has a downstairs bar/restaurant (Rare) with a lively atmosphere, and is located near several bars. Noise from the rooftop bar may be audible in some rooms.

The hotel is in a convenient location, a short walk from Grand Central Terminus. There are restaurants, a corner store, a beer and wine store, an English-style pub, and a Chinese restaurant within walking distance.

The Algonquin Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, making it convenient for accessing nightlife; however, some reviewers note noise from the street and nearby construction, which may affect sleep quality. The hotel also has a lively lobby bar, though it generally caters to an older clientele.

The Americana Inn is located a few blocks from Times Square and near the subway, but some rooms facing 6th Avenue experience street noise 24/7 and noise from slamming doors. Vending machines are available, and a deli across the street stays open 24 hours.

The Amsterdam Court Hotel is in a great location for nightlife, a few minutes walk from Times Square and close to bars; some rooms facing the street can be noisy. The hotel has a bar, often has a sushi bar or restaurant attached, and there's an Irish pub next door.
The hotel is a bit out of the way from downtown and touristy areas with no bars/restaurants nearby, but the subway is a few minutes walk away. A taxi back from Times Square costs approximately $11.

The Bedford Hotel is located in mid-town Manhattan near many bars, but taxis are required to reach downtown nightlife in Greenwich Village, Soho, or the Meatpacking District. The hotel has an Italian restaurant but lacks a hotel bar.
The hotel has a bar/restaurant on the top floor, but it's expensive. Some guests mentioned street noise.

The Belleclaire Hotel is in a great location on the Upper West Side, near many shops, restaurants and bars and close to the subway to get downtown cheap. Some reviewers mention street noise and sirens that can be heard from some rooms.

The Bentley Hotel is located in a quiet residential area, a long walk from shops and transportation, but with a couple of good bars and sushi restaurants within a 10-minute walk. The rooftop bar has great views, but a dreary atmosphere and terrible cocktails.
The Best Western Bowery Hanbee is located in Chinatown and near Little Italy, with several restaurants and shops nearby. Some reviewers mention that the area is noisy at night.

The Best Western Convention Center is a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square and Broadway, but some reviewers felt unsafe walking in the area at night. There is a 24-hour auto shop across the street that can be noisy, and a strip club is nearby.

The hotel is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of Times Square, with some restaurants and bars nearby. Some reviews mention potential noise issues from the street and air conditioning.

The Seaport Inn is in an area with many bars and restaurants, with nightlife bustling in the evenings. The hotel is across the street from Nelson Blue, a bar/restaurant, and close to other bars, cafes, and restaurants in the Seaport area.

The Blue Moon Hotel is located in the Lower East Side, close to trendy bars and restaurants, Little Italy, Chinatown, and hip hangouts on Ludlow. The hotel is located in an exciting area but still close to cosmopolitan areas and nightlife.

The Broadway Plaza Hotel is in a garment district that is bustling during the day but quiet and deserted at night, with very few restaurants and bars in the proximity. It is a 20-25 minute walk to Times Square.

The Buckingham Hotel is located on the corner of 6th Avenue and 57th Street, near a bus stop, and some reviewers mention street noise and sirens at all hours. There are multiple restaurants, delis and coffee shops nearby, and the hotel is within walking distance of Times Square and the Theater District.

The hotel is located a 5-10 minute walk from Times Square and close to restaurants and bars in Hell's Kitchen and restaurant row. Some reviews mention the area around the hotel can feel unsafe at night.
The Carlton Arms is located near many nightclubs and a popular Irish Pub, but street noise can be an issue. Rooms facing 3rd Ave can be noisy, but rooms facing the courtyard or 25th St are quieter.

The hotel is located on E 55th street and is convenient to a couple of subway lines, although a bit of a hike from Broadway theaters. Some reviewers suggested staying near Soho or NYU in Greenwich Village for more nightlife options.

Casablanca is located just off Times Square, within walking distance of broadway, alluding to the hotel's proximity to nightlife options. The hotel is also steps away from Times Square where there are many bars and restaurants.
The Chambers Hotel is located just off 5th Avenue, near shopping, Central Park, and the theater district. The hotel has a bar that seems hip and is often full.

Chelsea Lodge is in a great location with lots of local cafes, restaurants, supermarkets/pharmacies and is close to the subway; there are a high amount of restaurants and bars and a cinema in the area. It is located near numerous restaurants in Chelsea's GBLT district.
Chelsea Pines Inn is located near bars, clubs, restaurants, and the Meatpacking District. Some reviews mention that the subway is close by for easy access to the city's nightlife.

The Chelsea Savoy Hotel is in the Chelsea neighborhood, close to many restaurants, bars and clubs and within walking distance of Times Square. The hotel is near several subway lines, allowing for easy access to other parts of the city.

The City Club Hotel is located in midtown Manhattan, close to Times Square and the theater district, with easy access to restaurants, bars and clubs in the Meatpacking District and Soho; DB Bistro Moderne is located in the hotel, and O'Lunney's is nearby. The hotel does not have a lobby or bar.

The hotel is located near a nightclub, though noise may be an issue on lower floors, and is within walking distance of bars in SoHo and the Lower East Side. Some reviewers mention the hotel's proximity to live music and a lively, unpretentious crowd.

The Club Quarters Downtown is located in the Financial District, which is described as a ghost town on weekends and quiet at night. Some reviewers recommend staying in midtown Manhattan for a more lively experience.

Club Quarters Midtown is centrally located, within walking distance of Times Square, Broadway, and many restaurants and bars, with easy access to subway stations. Some reviewers mention street noise, and note the hotel lacks a bar on weekends.
Johnny Utah's bar/club is next door and a nightclub is nearby, but some reviewers on lower floors found it noisy. The hotel is also within walking distance of Broadway and Times Square.
The Comfort Inn Chelsea is near Jay-Z's 40/40 club and a few blocks from the Halloween parade route. Some reviewers noted noise from a nearby nightclub on Saturday nights.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan is centrally located with a short 10-15 minute walk to Times Square, close to subways, and near many restaurants and bars, including Irish pubs across the street that offer food and a good atmosphere. Some reviewers mention street noise, so rooms at the back of the hotel may be quieter.
The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge is located on the edge of Chinatown and near subway stops. The area quiets down at night, but is within walking distance of restaurants and Little Italy.
The Comfort Inn Midtown is located a block from Times Square. Some reviewers noted the proximity to restaurants, bars, and theaters.
This hotel is in the heart of the theater district, right off Times Square, with many restaurants, bars, and cafes within walking distance. It is also close to subway and bus stops.

The Comfort Inn is within walking distance of Times Square and the Theater District, and has public transportation nearby. Some reviewers mention walking back to the hotel late at night, and a halal pizza place that's open late.

The hotel is next door to a nightclub, with some reviews mentioning noise from the club that lasts until early morning; however, some guests on higher floors did not experience noise issues. The location is close to Times Square.

The Cooper Square Hotel is located in the Bowery/East Village area, close to many restaurants and bars, and has a bar/nightclub on the second floor. The hotel is also within walking distance of Greenwich Village, Soho, and Little Italy.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is located in Tribeca with many bars and restaurants nearby, as well as easy access to other districts via the subway. Some reviewers noted noise from the street, though rooms at the rear of the hotel are quieter.

The Courtyard Times Square South is in a great location, within walking distance of most Midtown sights and close to many subway lines. It is near Times Square and the Theatre District, but not directly in the hustle and bustle, which provides a quiet environment.

The Courtyard Upper East Side is located in a quiet, residential area, a long walk or short bus ride from the subway, and about a $20 cab ride to Times Square; the hotel has a restaurant and bar on the first floor that looks uninteresting, and no bar/lounge. There are some restaurants in the area, but not much in the way of nightlife.

This hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of Times Square. Some reviewers noted that the immediate surroundings of the hotel were quiet, while others appreciated the hotel's proximity to restaurants and bars.

The hotel is in a mostly business area, but it's within walking distance of the subway and some bars on 2nd Avenue; quick eats are nearby, and the Pig & Whistle is open until 4 AM. However, there is no bar or lounge in the hotel.
The Crosby Street Hotel is located in the heart of SoHo, steps away from subways, buses, and Broadway. The hotel has a bar with a bartender and a selection of over 400 bottles.

The Crowne Plaza Times Square is located right in the heart of Times Square and close to all the action on Broadway. Many reviewers mention the hotel's central location as a key feature, with several subway stops within walking distance.

The Da Vinci Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, with a bar and Italian restaurant, Joe G's, downstairs. It is within walking distance to the theater district, restaurants, and bars and close to subway lines.
The Doubletree Guest Suites Times Square is centrally located, right in Times Square and close to many theaters and bars. A reviewer notes the area is vibrant, though the rooms themselves are quiet.

The Doubletree Chelsea is centrally located near several subway lines and is easily walkable to Times Square; some reviewers mention that the hotel is located in a "sketchy shopping/flower district" and that they would not walk on 29th street alone at night. The hotel is also within walking distance of the Chelsea galleries, the fashion district, and the Broadway theater district.
The hotel has a trendy bar and is located near the subway, close to shopping, dining, and attractions, with some rooms experiencing noise from the street or a nearby fire station.

The Dream Hotel is located in the heart of Manhatten with a great bar on the roof and two clubs; one on the lobby level and one in the penthouse. It is a trendy hotel with a constant hub of guests or drivers and can get noisy at night.

The Duane Street Hotel is located in the Tribeca area of Lower Manhattan, within walking distance of SoHo and close to several subway lines. Some reviews mention street noise, but also proximity to bars and restaurants.

The Dylan Hotel is located near Grand Central Station and within walking distance of Times Square and the theater district. Some reviewers mention the hotel bar, but others report that the hotel restaurant and bar are closed.

The Eastgate Tower is located in Midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of Grand Central Station, with restaurants and delis nearby. Some reviewers mentioned that it was a 10-20 minute walk to Times Square, and/or the theater district.

This hotel is located near Times Square, close to Broadway theaters and Restaurant Row, but some reviewers noted that it can be noisy due to the location, with sirens and street noise. One review mentions a bar across the street that plays jazz until 4 AM.

This hotel is located in the Wall Street area, which is quiet in the evening, and several reviewers note the hotel bar closes early (7:30 PM). Some reviewers note that the subway is a 10-15 minute walk, but cabs are readily available to reach areas with nightlife.

The Empire Hotel has a rooftop bar that is a popular destination, though the bar is operated by a separate company and can be crowded. The hotel is near Columbus Circle subway station and has had celebrity sightings and filming, such as Gossip Girl, occur in the lobby.

The Envoy Club is located a few blocks from the Empire State Building and close to some eateries, but requires a taxi ride to the main shopping areas of the city; some reviewers found the location peaceful, while others found it far from the action. The rooftop deck offers views of the Manhattan skyline.
The hotel is located near the South Street Seaport and has good subway connections, allowing access to other parts of the city. There are many bars and restaurants near the hotel.

The Excelsior is located a bit away from downtown, but has a subway station on the corner for easy access to the city center. The jazz bar/restaurant is not attached to the hotel, so drinks cannot be brought to the rooms and the lounge closes early, around 10PM.

The hotel is a few blocks from Times Square and close to the subway, providing easy access to the city; it is also near 9th Avenue, known for its restaurants and Hell's Kitchen, which offers diverse dining experiences and a gay-friendly neighborhood with bars. However, the hotel's immediate street is described as gritty, desolate, and a bit rough, with adult video stores and a corrections office.

The Wheeltapper Pub attached to the hotel is mentioned as a nice starting and ending point for a night out, has a lively atmosphere and beer garden, and serves food at reasonable prices. Some found the location within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway.

The hotel has a lively bar (Fitzers) that is a great place to chat with fellow guests and get tips, and the hotel is within walking distance to many attractions. Some reviews mention the bar playing loud music and having a great atmosphere.
The Flatotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of Times Square and many restaurants. The hotel has a small lobby bar that seems fairly busy most nights.

The Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Chelsea has a bar/restaurant open until 4 AM and is located near subway lines. The hotel is located in Chelsea, within walking distance of nightlife and the Chelsea area's gay scene.

The Four Points Soho is within walking distance of SoHo and Greenwich Village restaurants, stores and bars, as well as the Blue Note jazz club. The hotel bar is small, but there are many places nearby to drink.

The hotel is near Times Square and Hell's Kitchen, both locations offering nightlife; it is close to many subway lines and cabs for transportation. Some reviewers note the location is on a street with adult shops and can be shady.
The hotel has a swanky bar that serves cool drinks and the location is near a lot of good restaurants. The bar during the week is quite happening with business types.

Gild Hall is located in the Financial District, which is generally quiet at night and on weekends, but is close to subway lines for accessing other parts of the city. Some reviewers recommend staying in Midtown East or West for first-time visitors to NYC who want to experience the nightlife.

The hotel has a popular late-night Rose Bar that requires reservations, as well as a rooftop bar open only to hotel guests. Some found it difficult to get into the Rose Bar even as hotel guests, and the rooftop bar sometimes closes early for private events.

The Grand Hyatt is in a central location with bars and restaurants in the surrounding area, and offers a bar on-site that's open until 1 AM. A short walk from the hotel will take you to Times Square and Broadway.
The hotel has a restaurant and bar, and is located near many great restaurants and cafes. Some guests have noted noise from the restaurant at night.

The Hampton Inn is near Macy's and Herald Square, but the nightlife in this area pretty much shuts down when Macy's closes. It is located in midtown Manhattan near a subway station for easy access to other areas.

The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden is centrally located near Penn Station, Times Square, and many restaurants and bars, but is described as quiet. Some reviewers mentioned nearby construction and demolition noise during the day.

The Hampton Inn Chelsea is near many gay bars and restaurants, making it a convenient location for experiencing gay New York nightlife; some rooms are well soundproofed from street noise. It is also within walking distance of some restaurants and cocktail spots.
The Hampton Inn Soho is near many restaurants, bars, and clubs and is located close to Greenwich Village, which has great nightlife. The hotel is located near a lot of hot spots.
The hotel is within walking distance of Times Square and the Theater District. It is located on a street that some reviewers describe as being in transition or a "sketchy section".

The hotel is near the South Street Seaport, which has restaurants, shops, bars, and views of the Brooklyn Bridge; it is also within walking distance of downtown attractions. Some reviewers noted the area can be quiet at night, but there are a few restaurants open within a two-block radius.

The Helmsley Middletowne Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and the Theater District, with some rooms offering nice city views. It is within walking distance of many attractions and has several restaurants and cafes nearby.
The hotel is within walking distance of Times Square, Radio City Hall, and Broadway shows. It is also close to key subway entrances and a train station.

The Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea is located a 10-minute walk from Times Square and near subway lines for easy access to other parts of Manhattan. Some reviewers note the area around the hotel is quiet at night, with limited restaurant options in the immediate vicinity.

The hotel is near many restaurants, bars and pubs including Korean restaurants and an Irish pub down the street, a pleasant bar with a welcoming barman, and O'Reilly's bar. One reviewer mentioned staying out late and walking towards the darker part of the street past 1:00 a.m. with no issues.

The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square is in a great location near theaters, restaurants, and Times Square; the immediate area has plenty of bars and nightlife. Some reviewers note street noise and sirens, even on higher floors, while others found it quiet.

The hotel is located near Soho and Tribeca with many bars and restaurants within walking distance, and is near the Canal Street subway stop. There were complaints of loud music from a club across the street on the weekends.

The Hilton New York is centrally located and within walking distance to many attractions, including the Theater District. Some guests mention a lively bar scene in the immediate area, and the hotel bar is open late.

The Hilton Times Square is located in the heart of the Theater District and Times Square, with many restaurants, nightlife, and bars within walking distance. The hotel is close to a subway station providing access to the rest of New York City.

The Holiday Inn Express is near Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and Broadway theaters, but some reviews mention that the area closes early, with cafes and restaurants shutting down after 7 p.m. There are a few Irish pubs located between the hotel and Times Square.

The Holiday Inn Express Times Square South is located a few blocks from Times Square, with some reviews noting that 9th Avenue is better to walk at night than 39th street due to businesses being closed. Some reviewers mention restaurants in Hell's Kitchen and Restaurant Row as nearby options.
Some guests mentioned being awoken by loud music coming from a nearby club or disco. A few guests noted thin walls and noise from slamming doors.

The hotel is near Chinatown, Little Italy, and Soho, with many restaurants, shops, and bars nearby; some reviewers mentioned the area felt safe to walk around at night. Some reviewers mentioned easy access to the subway for getting around the city.
The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square and the Theatre District. There is a bar in the hotel, however, some found the bar expensive and surly.

This hotel is located near Chelsea and the Garment district, close to subway stations and within walking distance of Times Square; a bar is located next door to the hotel, and Rogue Bar is around the corner. The hotel bar offers happy hour with half-priced drinks.

Hotel 17 is located near Union Square, the East Village, and St Marks Place, offering proximity to dive bars, groovy jukeboxes, and trendy spots; the hotel is within walking distance of shops in Soho and near nightlife in Alphabet City. Some reviewers mention it is easy to stumble home at 8 am and that the location makes it easy to walk to dive bars and stumble home at 8 AM.

Hotel 31 is in the Gramercy Park/Murray Hill area, full of bars and restaurants, and within walking distance to Times Square.
It is close to the subway and taxis always stop for me.
Hotel 373 is centrally located near the Empire State Building and within walking distance of Times Square, various bars, and clubs. However, some guests have noted noise from the street.

Hotel 41 is located steps from Times Square and close to many theaters, restaurants, and pubs, with a popular bar on site that's busy during happy hour. The bar is open late, but some guests in lower-level rooms have noted noise from the bar and street.

Hotel 99 is located on the Upper West Side, with the subway being only 3 blocks away for easy access to Times Square and other areas of the city. The hotel was still under construction during the time of these reviews, with some rooms completed and available.
The Beacon Hotel is located on the Upper West Side, near many restaurants, cafes, and bars, with some open until late. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the subway and close to Central Park.

The Hotel Chandler has a bar and is near other restaurants and bars in the area. Some reviewers mentioned being able to walk to Times Square (10-15 minutes), but some found the immediate area to be quiet.
The Hotel Deauville is in a great location for nightlife, within walking distance of Union Square and Times Square. Taxis are cheap and there are lots of restaurants and bars nearby on 3rd Ave.

The East Houston Hotel is located near many bars and restaurants in the Lower East Side, Soho, and East Village, and is described as being in a vibrant and trendy part of town. The hotel also has a rooftop terrace with city views.
The Hotel Elysee is near the Monkey Bar, and Bills bar is across the street. Some found the Monkey Bar lively at night and a fun place for a drink.

Located in the Meatpacking District, this hotel offers a rooftop bar and is close to clubs, bars and restaurants; some rooms have views, and it may be noisy at night. The hotel is a destination for younger crowds and offers VIP entry for hotel guests to some of the nightlife.

The hotel is next to Barna and Dos Caminos, which seem to be popular with young people, and Barna turns into a high-energy lounge from 10 PM to 4 AM. The hotel also has a roof top bar, but some guests experienced noise from the street and a club in the hotel.

The Grand Union Hotel is centrally located near the Empire State Building and has easy access to subway lines, making it convenient to reach various parts of New York City. Some reviewers noted nearby bars and restaurants, but also mentioned potential street noise.
The Hotel Indigo is in close proximity to Times Square, the Meatpacking District, and multiple subway lines. The hotel bar offers cocktails.

Hotel Mela is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, right off Times Square, and within walking distance of many theaters, restaurants, and bars. Some reviewers note its proximity to nightlife and entertainment venues, while others mention the hotel's quiet atmosphere despite its central location.

The Hotel Metro is centrally located, within walking distance to Times Square, 5th Avenue, and Broadway, and is near a subway stop. It offers a rooftop bar with views of the Empire State Building, though it is sometimes closed.

Hotel Newton is located near the subway with express lines downtown, close to many shops, bars, and restaurants including the Dive Bar on Amsterdam Ave. Some reviewers mention the street-facing rooms can be noisy.

The Hotel on Rivington is located in the Lower East Side, an area known for its nightlife, bars and clubs, and lively atmosphere; some reviewers noted street noise and partying until late, while others mentioned the hotel bar being busy on weekends. The hotel also has a first floor bar/restaurant and doormen.

The Hotel Reserve is located in the Financial District, which some reviewers note becomes very quiet at night and on weekends, with limited late-night dining options. Some reviewers mentioned nearby bars, but the immediate area is generally described as a "ghost town" on Sundays.

The St. James Hotel is in a prime location, near Times Square and Broadway, with several pubs and restaurants on the same block, some open until 4 am. Some reviewers mention noise from outside generators and street traffic, while others found rooms away from the street to be quiet.
The Stanford Hotel is located in Korea Town, near many late-night Korean restaurants, and a 24-hour deli. The hotel has a small bar that specializes in jazz and karaoke.

The Hotel Wales is located on the Upper East Side, away from the hustle and bustle of downtown and about 30 minutes and $15 by cab from Times Square. There are few bars nearby, but many restaurants and museums are within walking distance.

The Hudson Hotel has a lively lobby bar and nightclub that is popular with guests and locals, often open until late at night with exclusive parties. Some reviewers noted noise from the club could be heard in lower-floor rooms, but that the hotel was near bars, with a roof terrace.

Ink48 is located on 11th Ave between 48th & 49th St, a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square; some found the location a little out of the way, and the neighborhood gritty and deserted late at night, but convenient for cabs to get uptown or downtown without so much traffic. There are restaurants, bars and clubs in Hell's Kitchen, and the hotel is within walking distance to shopping, Times Square and the Empire State Building.

The Inn is located a few blocks from restaurants, shops, movie theaters, and Broadway, and a short walk to the subway, museums, and Central Park. The Inn is on a quiet street, and some reviewers appreciated being away from the hustle and bustle of more touristy areas.

The Barclay Intercontinental is located in Midtown East, which is convenient to mid-town attractions but a little distanced from the heaviest tourist traffic and nightlife, with easy access to many of Manhattan's sights. Some reviewers note that there is not much nightlife in this part of town, but you can find anything you want by walking 20 minutes to Times Square.

The hotel bar can be very lively and interesting and the hotel's location is convenient to many attractions, such as Columbus Circle, Broadway, and Times Square, with several options for a pint nearby. The hotel also has Black limos which you can use on a first come first serve basis within a 10-block radius.
The Kitano has a jazz lounge with live music, however it closes early. It is located within walking distance of Times Square.

The hotel has a rooftop bar open until 1 AM and is near Korean karaoke bars, Pinkberry, and other nightlife spots. Some reviewers mention noise from the rooftop bar and some noise from the ice machine.

The Lafayette House is located in the East Village and near NYU, the Village, Soho, Nolita, and the Lower East Side. The hotel is next door to a wine bar, close to the B Bar and Grill, and near many restaurants.

Le Parker Meridien houses a cozy bar that's open late (3 AM), and is located within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway. There is also a popular burger joint in the lobby with a fun atmosphere.
The Library Hotel has a rooftop bar called Bookmarks and is near Midtown East dining and nightlife. Madison and Vine, the hotel restaurant, has a wine bar with live music.

The hotel has an adjacent nightclub for a mellow evening of jazz, and the Library bar is a great place to hang out. Some reviews mention that the hotel's location is not ideal for Broadway shows or Times Square.

There is no information about the nightlife around this hotel. However, the hotel is located near designer stores on Park and Madison Avenues, and the Post House bar is frequented by celebrities for its privacy and charm.

The hotel's location near Columbus Circle provides access to Time Warner Center shops and restaurants, with some reviewers noting proximity to Times Square and theaters. However, some reviews mention a more commercial feel to the area and that it is better suited for business trips than experiencing authentic New York life.

The Milford Plaza is located near Broadway theaters, close to Times Square, and a short walk to restaurants and bars. Many reviewers note its proximity to broadway shows, times square, and various restaurants.

The Millenium Hilton is located in the financial district, which is quiet at night, but is within walking distance of Tribeca, Greenwich Village and SOHO, or a subway ride away from midtown Manhattan. A bar is available but there are not a lot of things to do at night.

The Millennium Broadway is located right off Times Square and within walking distance to a number of restaurants, comedy clubs and Broadway shows; it also has doormen and is considered quiet and safe. A few steps from Times Square and Broadway, the hotel is right in the middle of the theater district and close to many restaurants.
The Millennium UN Plaza is located a 15–20-minute walk to Times Square, with several restaurants on Second and Third Avenues. The hotel is located a five-minute walk to Grand Central station.
The Moderne Hotel is centrally located near Broadway and Times Square, with an Irish pub across the street. Some reviews mention noise from the street or nearby AC units.
There isn't much nightlife in Midtown, but taxis are plentiful and relatively cheap. The hotel is close to many bars and restaurants on 36th and 34th streets.

The hotel is not the best place to go out at night, but the subway is just 10 minutes away.
There are pubs and restaurants right around the hotel.

The hotel is located in midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of the Empire State Building, Macy's, Times Square, and Grand Central Station and near subway lines. Some reviewers mention the hotel is on a quiet street but near bars and restaurants.

The hotel is located in the Financial District, which is quiet in the evenings and on weekends, but near subway lines for easy access to other parts of Manhattan. Some reviewers noted the area has limited eateries and activity at night, while others mentioned nearby bars and restaurants.

The hotel has a lively lobby bar, is close to the W Hotel's bar called Whiskey Blue, and is near many restaurants and bars on 2nd Ave, but the hotel bar stops serving early. The hotel is located in midtown, but some found the area dead at night.

The Marriott Marquis is located right in Times Square, placing it in the heart of the city's nightlife and within walking distance of Broadway shows, restaurants, and bars. It features multiple bars, a revolving restaurant/bar with city views, and proximity to subway lines for accessing other parts of New York.

Gilt bar is located inside the hotel, offering food, drinks, and a bar scene until late, and it is closely located to Midtown businesses and shops. There are many great restaurant choices nearby and Gilt provides recommendations and reservations, though some may consider this and other hotel restaurants quiet expensive to eat or drink in.

The Night Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, with some reviews mentioning a small bar/lounge and proximity to nightlife options like Irish pubs. Some reviews mention noise from the hotel bar or nearby construction, while others note the quiet atmosphere of the rooms.

The Novotel is located in the heart of Times Square and the Theater District, within walking distance of Broadway shows; the hotel has a terrace overlooking Times Square and a bar that's open until midnight. The hotel is near Broadway shows, shops, restaurants and the M&M store is close by.

Off Soho Suites is located within walking distance of many bars, restaurants, and music venues, and is close to the Soho, Greenwich Village, Little Italy, and Chinatown neighborhoods. The hotel is also near several subway stations, providing easy access to other parts of the city.

Some guests recommend the meat packing district for bars, clubs, and restaurants. The Fireside Restaurant and Bar at the hotel is a nice place for a late-night drink and to watch sports on the large screens.

The hotel is located on the Upper West Side, with a number of restaurants and diners nearby, including the Manhattan Diner which is open 24 hours. Some past guests found the neighborhood had a "villagey" feel with lots of restaurants, or enjoyed the neighborhood for its "lack of tourists" and proximity to special events at the Lincoln Center.
The hotel is located in the Upper West Side, with some bars and restaurants within a 5-minute walk, and a 10-dollar cab ride to Times Square. There may be noise from neighbors due to thin walls.

The Park Central Hotel is in a central location, walking distance from Times Square, which has Broadway shows and many bars; the presentation is impeccable, and the room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is located near subway lines, and is close to the Carnegie Deli, best known for pastrami sandwiches, and Cafe Europa.

The hotel is near the subway and several restaurants and bars, with a bar/restaurant on-site that features live jazz on weekends. Some reviewers mentioned noise from the street or air conditioning units.

The Peninsula has a rooftop bar that is a popular nightspot with great views; however, some reviewers mention that the downstairs bar sometimes closes early. The hotel is also within walking distance of Broadway theaters.
The Phillips Club is near the 1 and 9 train and several Broadway bus lines. Some reviewers mention that the location is close to Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle.

The hotel bar is noted as cozy, with one reviewer mentioning drinks, light meals, and snacks. The hotel is near restaurants on the Upper East Side, with one restaurant recommendation at Madison and 66th.

The hotel is centrally located near a subway station and within walking distance of Times Square and the theater district. Some reviewers mentioned nearby Korean restaurants and karaoke, and a lively bar scene can be found in Greenwich Village a subway ride away.

The hotel is in a good location, close to a subway, and within walking distance of the Empire State Building, with some restaurants and pubs nearby. It is located in a quieter part of NY, away from the crowds.

The Red Roof Inn is located near 24-hour Korean bars and restaurants, though some reviews mention noise from the street and nearby bars that make sleeping difficult. The hotel has a small bar, and is conveniently located near subways, Times Square, and other attractions.
The hotel has a restaurant, lounge, and bar and is located near shopping, attractions, and public transportation. Some found the location to be loud and busy, even for Manhattan.

The Renaissance New York Hotel Times Square is located in the heart of Times Square. It's steps away from broadway shows, with the action continuing into the night and some reviewers found the noise levels acceptable.

The hotel is a short walk to Times Square and the Theater District and has a small bar open until midnight, and some reviewers mention local Irish pubs nearby. Some reviewers note the area is thronged with workers during the day, and has no neighborhood life at night.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park is located in lower Manhattan, a 15-20 minute taxi or subway ride to Midtown; the hotel bar on the 14th floor has outdoor spectacular views. Some reviewers noted limited nightlife in the immediate area and restaurant/bar closing times of 10-10:30 PM.
The Rockefeller Center Hotel is centrally located near Radio City Music Hall, 5th Avenue, and Times Square. Some reviewers mentioned a nightclub (Johnny Utah) in the basement.

The Roger Smith Hotel has a bar called Lily's that is busy most afternoons and evenings; there is also a hot dance club next door that can get noisy between 2-4 AM. The hotel's central midtown location means it is within walking distance to many bars and restaurants.

The Roger Williams Hotel is conveniently located near subways, shopping, and within walking distance of Times Square; some reviewers noted that the immediate neighborhood lacks bars for a nightcap. However, the hotel has a lobby bar and is within walking distance of restaurants in Chelsea and Gramercy.

Room Mate Grace, located near Times Square, features a pool and bar area with nightly DJs and parties that create a lively atmosphere; some reviews mention parties continuing until 2 or 3 AM and potential noise on lower floors. Some guests mention security checks to enter the hotel late at night.

The Royalton Hotel has a lobby bar that is popular and busy on most nights, with a trendy atmosphere, serving cocktails and snacks; the hotel is also located close to Times Square. Some reviewers noted the bar prices were high and the hotel atmosphere was pretentious.

The Salisbury Hotel is located on 57th street near several attractions and subways and offers clean, spacious rooms. It does not have a bar or restaurant but there are some restaurants and diners nearby.
The San Carlos is centrally located with proximity to the subway and walking distance to attractions. There is a nightclub across the street from the hotel and some street noise.

The Seafarers International House is located near Union Square, close to bars and restaurants, with some rooms potentially experiencing street noise. An Irish bar is next door, and the subway is easily accessible for nightlife in other parts of the city.
Located in the heart of Times Square, the hotel provides easy access to shows and a bustling atmosphere. Some reviewers noted noise from the street and neighboring rooms.

The Skyline Hotel is within walking distance of the theater district and Times Square, and it has a bar; some guests noted noise from neighbors or the nearby train. Some reviewers mention that the bar scene was "dead" while others found it a nice place to end the evening.

The hotel is located in Tribeca, close to many restaurants, shops, and bars, and within walking distance of the West Village and Meatpacking District. The subway is right outside the hotel, making it easy to get uptown.
The Sofitel New York is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, making it convenient to the Theatre District. The hotel has a bar.

The Soho Grand Hotel has a buzzing bar and lounge with DJs, open late, and a great atmosphere, but it can get crowded. Its location in SoHo provides convenient access to shops, restaurants, and nightlife.
Soho House is located in the Meatpacking District, surrounded by bars, restaurants, and clubs, and the area is busy until late at night. The hotel has a rooftop bar and club room.

The Stay Hotel has a lively bar that turns into a nightclub until 4 AM on weekends, but some rooms are located above the bar and can be noisy. The Aspen Social Club is a popular hangout with a DJ on Friday and Saturday nights.

The Alex Hotel is located near an authentic Irish pub, Amish Market, cheap diner, and an organic food store. Some reviews mention a good bar right next door and that the location puts you in the center yet offers you a wonderful taste of the buzz of the city.

The Belvedere Hotel is located in midtown Manhattan, close to Times Square and Broadway theaters, as well as Restaurant Row, and the nearby Hell's Kitchen neighborhood offers many dining options and late night bars. A subway stop is close by, and many sites are within walking distance.
The hotel bar closes early, but 2nd Avenue is nearby with bars and restaurants. The hotel is also near many activities and affordable restaurants, and Nikki Beach is a short walk away.
Rooms facing 55th Street can be noisy, and some reviewers mention noise from garbage trucks in the early morning. Bars close at 4 AM near the hotel.

The Bowery Hotel is located near Bleecker Street and is close to great nightlife, with a popular bar/lounge that is frequented by locals; the bar scene is edgy with a good mix, and drinks are available late. Gemma, the hotel restaurant, has a buzzy ambiance that is great for people-watching.

The Bryant Park Hotel has a lively Cellar Bar with music and go-go dancers that is open late, and hotel guests get priority access. The hotel is centrally located near Times Square and within walking distance of nightlife.
Carlton Hotel is located near many bars, and is conveniently located next to a metro station. However, some reviewers noted that the bar closes early and there is noise from clubs across the street.
The Carlyle has a bar with live jazz and a supper club, and is near Madison Avenue boutiques. It is known as a place where celebrities and heads of state stay.

The Franklin Hotel is located on the Upper East Side, which is described as quieter and more residential than other areas of NYC. Reviews mention the hotel's proximity to the subway, but also note that it is not within walking distance to theaters, shopping, and other attractions.

The hotel is located near Times Square and Restaurant Row, with a pub downstairs (Bourbon Street) and connections to local bars. Some reviewers mentioned noise from the bar below, while others did not experience any noise issues.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea is located in the heart of Chelsea, close to many restaurants and a block from the subway, making it easily accessible to other areas of Manhattan. Some reviewers mention a great location in Chelsea off 8th Ave, with many bars and restaurants in the neighborhood.

The hotel is located a 10-15 minute walk from Broadway and near Penn Station, but some reviewers found the area a little creepy to walk back to from the theater district at night and recommended taxis. The hotel is also near a lot of restaurants, fast food places and bars.

The GEM Hotel SoHo is located near many bars, restaurants, and clubs, and is within walking distance of the East Village, Little Italy, and Chinatown. It is conveniently located near subway and bus lines.

The Grant Hotel is near the 96th Street subway station and a 10-minute cab ride from Times Square, with restaurants, diners, and 24-hour grocery stores nearby. A late-night taco truck also operates near the hotel.

The Hampton Inn Times Square North is a hotel in a central location near Times Square and Broadway theaters, with a 24-hour diner across the street. Nightlife clubs are also mentioned as being "right around the corner."

The hotel is located on the upper east side of Manhattan, one block from Central Park and close to shopping and restaurants, but a short cab ride to Times Square and Museum Mile. Some rooms have kitchenettes, sitting areas, and balconies overlooking Central Park.
The Helmsley Park Lane hotel is located near a subway station and within walking distance of Times Square and 5th Avenue. Some reviewers mention Harry's Bar as a nice place for cocktails.

The Herald Square Hotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, close to the Empire State Building, Macy's, and several subway stations, with some rooms offering flat-screen TVs and comfortable beds. Some reviewers mention an Irish pub a block away and a trendy restaurant-cafe next door, but note that some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic.

Hotel 91 is located in Chinatown, which some reviewers note is quiet after 9 PM with limited options for nightlife, though close to Little Italy, the East Village, and SoHo which offer bars and restaurants. Transportation to other areas of Manhattan for nightlife requires a subway or taxi ride.

The Hotel at Times Square is near many restaurants and bars, as well as Times Square and the theater district. There is a bar on site, but some found the staff unfriendly and unhelpful with suggestions for local entertainment.

The Inn at Irving Place has a bar in its basement with an outdoor patio (Cibar), which has been known to generate noise complaints from guests, especially those on the second floor. The bar is popular, sometimes playing garage music, and stays open late with kids hanging out in front until 3am.

The Iroquois is centrally located near Times Square and many theaters, with a small bar and restaurant (Triomphe). Some found it close to the Theatre District for shows and some note the bar is open late, though others noted early closures.

The Jane Hotel has a popular club accessed through the lobby and is located in the Meatpacking District/West Village, close to many bars and restaurants. The hotel bar is sometimes closed to residents for private parties.
The Kimberly Hotel is located in midtown Manhattan near many attractions. Some past guests have mentioned there is convenient access to bars, jazz, and opera.

The Lombardy is located on 56th St between Park and Lex, within walking distance of restaurants, diners, and bars, and three blocks from the subway. The hotel is also within walking distance of the park and shopping on 5th.
The London NYC has a lively bar that is open until 1 AM with strong cocktails. The hotel is centrally located near Times Square, Broadway, and upscale restaurants.

The Lucerne is located on the Upper West Side, with some reviews mentioning the presence of nearby bars and restaurants that are open late; some reviewers noted the area can be noisy with traffic. The subway is a block away, providing access to other parts of Manhattan.

The Manhattan Club is centrally located near Times Square, Broadway, and many restaurants; it also has a bar and common living room on the 26th floor. Some reviewers mention that it's easy to walk to the theater district, and that the location is great for experiencing the energy of New York City.
The Mansfield Hotel is in a central location near Times Square and has an adjoining bar area with live jazz. Some guests mention noise from the street and nearby clubs.

The Marcel is next to a lively bar/restaurant, Inoteca, with a neighborhood feel and good cocktails. Several reviewers noted the hotel's proximity to fun bars and restaurants, but also mentioned noise from the street and neighboring rooms.

The Maritime Hotel is located in the heart of the Meatpacking District and Chelsea, near many restaurants, bars and shops. The hotel has a lively atmosphere with a popular bar and outdoor terrace, but the noise from the hotel's nightclub and outdoor spaces can be disruptive to guests on lower floors.
The Mark is located on the Upper East Side, close to museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping. The Mark Bar and restaurant are also located within the hotel.

The Marmara Manhattan is located on the Upper East Side, which is a more residential area, and some reviewers noted it is not where you want to stay if you want to be out late in the hustle and bustle of downtown. The subway is a few blocks away and can take you to Times Square in 10 minutes and uptown Manhattan in around 25 minutes.

The hotel staff can recommend dinners and night spots, and help arrange dinner reservations as well as club passes/guest list. The hotel's location is convenient to the theaters and it is near a 24-hour hair salon.

The Mercer is located in SoHo, within walking distance of many bars and restaurants; the hotel has a lobby bar open only to hotel residents and their guests. The hotel is near the subway, making it easy to get around the city, and is located across the street from Fanelli's Bar.

The Michelangelo Hotel is located near Broadway and Times Square, convenient to theaters and restaurants, with some rooms offering a view of the city. The hotel has a bar in the lobby and is near the Halal chicken and gyro cart on 53rd and 6th.

The Milburn Hotel is located on the Upper West Side, a few blocks from subway stations for easy access to Times Square, Broadway, and other sites. It is near many shops and restaurants, and the Manhattan Diner is across the street, offering 24-hour service.

The Muse Hotel is located a half block from Times Square, near theaters, subway, and restaurants, but some rooms facing the street experience noise. The hotel offers a complimentary happy hour in the evenings.

The New York Helmsley is within walking distance of Times Square and has a bar on site that serves drinks and food; some reviewers mentioned the bar is a welcome oasis after a long day. Additionally, some reviewers mentioned local bars, pubs, and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.

The hotel is centrally located near many attractions and has subway stations nearby, making it easy to get around the city, and it's a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square. There are restaurants and bars attached to the hotel or close by, including a 24-hour diner and an Irish bar.

The Pierre has a new lobby bar and restaurant called Caprice that appear to be popular spots well into the evening. The hotel's location is convenient and a cheap cab ride to just about anywhere in the city.

The Plaza Hotel is located in close proximity to shopping, restaurants, night life and Broadway theaters. The hotel has bars, including the Oak Room and Rose Club, and is located on 5th Avenue, near Central Park.

The hotel is close to restaurants and bars and has a rooftop terrace, and the French bistro next door is open until 4 AM. There are also reports of noise at night, and its proximity to a subway station makes it easy to access different parts of the city.
The Premier is located half a block from Times Square on 44th street. It is steps from Times Square and within walking distance of many attractions.
The hotel features a lobby bar that is considered one of the best in NYC and has a Star Lounge. The concierge can provide recommendations for dining and Broadway shows.
The Roosevelt Hotel has a location where is a short walk to Broadway and close to Times Square. The hotel also has a lively lobby bar.
The Sherry-Netherland is located at 5th Ave and 59th, across from Central Park and close to 5th Avenue shopping. Broadway theaters, Rockefeller Center, restaurants, and museums are a short walk away.
The Shoreham has a bar that's popular with locals and hotel guests, but it doesn't serve drinks past midnight. Some guests found it noisy due to street noise, while others enjoyed the bar scene.

The hotel has a bar, the King Cole Bar, which is known as the birthplace of the Bloody Mary [originally the Red Snapper] and the famous mural. Also, the hotel's location on 5th Avenue and 55th St., is close to prime shopping, Central Park and Rockefeller Center.

Located in the Meatpacking District, The Standard Hotel is in a lively area with great restaurants and clubs, and the 18th-floor lounge turns into a nightclub after 9 pm. The hotel also has downstairs bars with a good atmosphere and packed bar scene.

This hotel is located on the Upper East Side, with some reviews mentioning it being a few blocks from the subway, and walking distance to restaurants on Lexington Avenue. One review notes it is not near a lot of subway options and recommends cabs.

The Sylvan Guest House is located in Harlem, with some reviewers noting a 20-minute train ride to Times Square and a subway stop nearby for access to Manhattan. Some guests have expressed concerns about safety when walking back from the train station at night.

The Time Hotel has a trendy bar/lounge that is a happening spot, especially on weekends, and is near Times Square and Broadway, offering access to entertainment and nightlife. Some reviewers mention noise from the bar can be an issue on lower floors.

The hotel has a bar, Sir Harry's, but drinks are expensive and the lobby is bustling with activity, sometimes hosting weddings, which may suit those seeking a busy atmosphere. Some reviewers mention there are many bars and restaurants nearby outside the hotel that may be more affordable.
The Westin New York Times Square is located one block from Times Square and within walking distance of many theaters. Bar 10 is the hotel's cocktail lounge and is open late.

The Thirty Thirty Hotel is centrally located in Manhattan, within walking distance of Times Square and a short cab ride to other nightlife destinations. The hotel is near a variety of bars and restaurants, including a pub across the street, although the hotel bar has been described as expensive.

The Thompson LES is located in the Lower East Side, close to many bars and restaurants, with some rooms offering views of the city; the hotel has a bar that can be loud due to its proximity to guest rooms. Some reviewers mention noise from the 7th floor bar as a potential issue for light sleepers.

The Travel Inn is located on 42nd street, a few blocks from Times Square and within walking distance to many bars and restaurants in Hell's Kitchen, with some rooms facing away from the street for a quieter stay. It also has easy access to public transportation for access to nightlife throughout Manhattan.

The Tribeca Grand has a lively bar and lounge that is a popular nightlife spot, but the noise can be disruptive to guests trying to sleep. The hotel also has a club in the basement that is open late on weekends.
The hotel is within walking distance of the theater district, broadway, times square, many restaurants and bars and close to Columbus Circle subway station. Some suites feature a kitchen.

The Tudor Hotel is located on the east side of midtown Manhattan, a 15-minute walk to Times Square. Some reviews mention a bar in the hotel and an Irish pub across the street, but also note that the surrounding area is quiet at night.

The Avalon Hotel's bar is open from 5 PM to 11 PM, and it is located near Murray Hill and 2nd Avenue which offer unique places to eat and drink. Some reviewers mention the hotel can be noisy, but it is located near many attractions.

The Wet Bar is a happening spot with an energetic vibe, while Audrey, the bar next door at the W Tuscany, offers a more peaceful and "grownup" atmosphere. On weekends, the hotel bar gets very lively and crowded with 20-30 somethings looking to mingle after work.

The W Tuscany is close to Times Square and Broadway, providing access to day and nightlife, and is near a bar in the neighboring W Court Hotel. However, some reviews note the surrounding Murray Hill area is quiet, and not necessarily convenient for nightlife.

The W Times Square is a trendy hotel with a bustling lobby bar, a basement club, and is centrally located near many restaurants and entertainment venues. Some reviewers note the bar scene can be lively and crowded, with potential for noise.

The W Union Square has a bar/lounge area that is crowded and lively, and a night spot called "Underbar." Some reviews mention the lobby bar attracting a hip crowd and being a great place for people-watching.
The Waldorf Towers is centrally located in NYC, within walking distance of Broadway Theatres and Times Square. Guests also have access to all of the Waldorf-Astoria facilities.

The Wall Street Inn is located in the Financial District, which is noted as being quiet, especially on weekends and at night. Some reviewers noted that the hotel's location was not ideal for nightlife and those seeking more action may prefer to stay in midtown.

Randolph's bar has a comfortable atmosphere and serves light food and drinks, while Murals on 54 is a more formal dining option; there are also several bars in close proximity to the hotel. Randolph's Loung offers a great respite from all of the shopping and sight-seeing with great casual fare and very nice drinks.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel is located near Times Square and Broadway, with some rooms facing 51st street near bistros with outdoor seating and a pub next door. Some reviewers mentioned noise from traffic, garbage trucks, and bar patrons at night.

The Washington Square Hotel is in Greenwich Village, near many bars, restaurants, and music venues including the Village Vanguard, Blue Note and Iridium, with Bleeker Street and a good jazz scene within walking distance. The hotel also has a bar.

The Wellington Hotel is conveniently located in Midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway, but some reviewers noted noise from the streets. Some reviewers mentioned there was a Greek restaurant and bar attached to the hotel.

The hotel is centrally located in Manhattan, near Carnegie Hall, close to multiple subway lines, and within walking distance of Times Square and several restaurants. The hotel has a lounge for owners where they have evening hors d'oeuvres.

Some guests have complained about noise, particularly in rooms facing the street, with garbage trucks and other street sounds being disruptive at night; a few reviews mention a disco outside that was noisy until late at night. The hotel provides earplugs and white noise machines to mitigate the noise.

The Wolcott Hotel is in a central location, near the Empire State Building, Macy's, Times Square, and subway stations; some reviewers mention noise from the street, slamming doors, and old heating systems. There is no bar in the hotel, but there are restaurants nearby, including a 24-hour breakfast place.

Woogo Central Park is located on the Upper West Side near the 72nd street subway station, with access to the 1, 2, and 3 lines; some reviewers mention nearby restaurants and bars, while others note noise from the street or garbage trucks. Front desk staff is available 9 am - 10 pm, with a doorman present at other times.

The Wyndham Garden Hotel is within walking distance of Times Square and the Theater District.
Some reviewers note the area around the hotel is quiet or deserted at night, and some felt unsafe walking alone.
